values.name: base
values.prose: When applied on a form control, base puts that control in the basic appearance state.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The slider-like control orientation is defined by the writing mode and direction.

values.name: left-to-right
values.prose: The slider-like control is rendered horizontally and ::fill is left-aligned within the control.

values.name: right-to-left
values.prose: The slider-like control is rendered horizontally and ::fill is right-aligned within the control.

values.name: top-to-bottom
values.prose: The slider-like control is rendered vertically and ::fill is top-aligned within the control.

values.name: bottom-to-top
values.prose: The slider-like control is rendered vertically and ::fill is bottom-aligned within the control.

selectors.name: ::picker()
selectors.prose: The ::picker() pseudo-element represents the part of the form control that pops out of the page.

selectors.name: ::picker-icon
selectors.prose: The ::picker-icon pseudo-element represents the part of the control that represents the icon denoting the presence of the picker. It is only generated when the originating element has basic appearance and if it opens a picker. It is a fully styleable pseudo-element and inherits from its originating element.

selectors.name: ::file-selector-button
selectors.prose: The ::file-selector-button pseudo-element represents the button used to open a file picker, if the UA renders such a button.

selectors.name: ::checkmark
selectors.prose: The ::checkmark pseudo-element represents an indicator of whether the item is checked, and is present on checkboxes, radios, and option elements.

selectors.name: ::thumb
selectors.prose: The ::thumb pseudo-element represents the portion that allows the user to adjust the progress of the control.

selectors.name: ::track
selectors.prose: The ::track pseudo-element represents the portion containing both the progressed and unprogressed portions of the control.

selectors.name: ::fill
selectors.prose: The ::fill pseudo-element represents the portion containing the progressed portion of the control. When the progress of control is undetermined (like with <progress indeterminate>), the user agent must give this portion an inline-size of zero.

selectors.name: ::placeholder
selectors.prose: The ::placeholder pseudo-element represents the portion of the input that contains the placeholder text.

selectors.name: ::field-text
selectors.prose: The ::field-text pseudo-element represents the portion of the input that contains the editable text.

selectors.name: ::clear-icon
selectors.prose: The ::clear-icon pseudo-element represents the portion of the input that allows the user to clear the input when clicked if provided by the user agent. With appearance: textfield, the user agent must not generate this part.

selectors.name: ::step-control
selectors.prose: The ::step-control pseudo-element represents the portion of a number input that contains the up and down buttons.

selectors.name: ::step-up
selectors.prose: The ::step-up pseudo-element represents the button that increments the value inside a number input when activated.

selectors.name: ::step-down
selectors.prose: The ::step-down pseudo-element represents the button that decrements the value inside a number input when activated.

selectors.name: ::field-component
selectors.prose: The ::field-component pseudo-element represents the portions of the control that contain the date/time component values.

selectors.name: ::field-separator
selectors.prose: The ::field-separator pseudo-element represents the portions of the control that separate the date/time component values if the user agent provides those portions.

selectors.name: ::color-swatch
selectors.prose: The ::color-swatch pseudo-element represents the portion of the control that displays the chosen color value.

selectors.name: :low-value
selectors.prose: The :low-value pseudo-class matches on a meter element when its value is under the value specified by the low HTML attribute.

selectors.name: :high-value
selectors.prose: The :high-value pseudo-class matches on a meter element when its value is over the value specified by the high HTML attribute.

selectors.name: :optimal-value
selectors.prose: The :optimal-value pseudo-class matches on a meter element when its value is in the range determined by the optimum / low / high HTML attributes.

values.name: control-value()
values.prose: The control-value() function computes to the current value of the form control it is on. If it is used on an element that is not a form control, it returns an empty string.
